page.title: 16RECREATION_SPORTS CENTRE_
page.content: Stanley Louisa centre took 3 years to build.It was finally completed on the 8th of April 1980.It was opened by the Chairman of Derwentside District Council.The sports centre employs 6 full staff workers and 16 part time staff.Altogether the building has 2 court halls,6 squash courts,a wieght training room,a projectile room,a club room and a creche.The Louisa centre is more popular in winter than in summer. The main hall is used most for badminton and 5 aside football. There is no particular age group that go to the Louisa because both children and adults from the under 5 creche to the over 50 keep,fit class go.On average the Louisa takes Â£1,200 pounds a week which in an area with low employment shows how popular it must be.The bar is not as popular as some sports facilities but still attracts people.
